Well lets hear it. im talking about a seperate issue i have long ques because of a lol glitch. Not the first time i have seen several glitches that have stuffed playability in the last 8 years. (ENOUGH IS ENOUGH). I want compensation and i will take this to consumer affairs. I am not the only one i have 10 other Australians that have spent considerable amounts of money aswell and we have all experienced a problem multiple times from one time to another. ENOUGH IS ENOUGH. 20 mninutes here 20 minutes there. 8 years later your wasting 1000,s of hours of our life when we have paid for a service even though its a free game we have paid and have had enough clearly.

You are only entitled to be refunded for money spent, if you did not receive an adequate good or service.

In purchasing RP and skins, you are not paying for the game, and thus have no legal right to expect it to be glitch free. 

If you spend $50 on RP and never got it credited to your account, or bought a skin and were never able to use it, then you would have a legal right to be refunded. 

As it stand you paid zero for the access to your account and the game files, hence any associated glitches are can not be refunded simple because your paid nothing for them.

So being stuck on the portal and displaying a skin but not being able to use your character is a disagreement obviously. I find that a breech of playable content and is absolutely grounds for a refund or consumer affairs. Considering my last to post on this topic seem to be deleted that admits fault and Riot does not want this exposure for breaking united states law and Oceanic consumer law?

Hint: they still haven't broken the law, and no consumer affairs will go after them.

That is problems on your end, it's not Riots fault, therefore your not paying for a faulty product (just trying to access said product on a faulty product)

If you have bought a skin and are unable to use it, contact Riot support. 
They have transaction histories and will be able to see your purchase.  
Make sure you write in a calm and clear manner, while still readable what you write is written in a confusing manner. 

I'm not sure what you are referring to by being stuck in the portal.
Are you able to log into the client?
This would no be an issue at Riot's end either, simply demonstrated by the fact that millions of others can play glitch free. 

I would suggest;
1. A repair (if this is still possible, it should be found on the launcher)
2. Uninstall/reinstall
3. Posting/Searching on the Help forums for people with similar techincal issues
4. Emailing support with as much clear and concise information.

Your focus should be on fixing the issues at hand not getting your money back because this is VERY unlikely to happen.

>Products must be of acceptable quality, that is:

>    safe, lasting, with no faults
    look acceptable
    do all the things someone would normally expect them to do.

These are all accurate, unless you count bugs which are fixed by riot on a regular basis, so this means this is covered.

>Products must also:

>    match descriptions made by the salesperson, on packaging and labels, and in promotions or advertising
    match any demonstration model or sample you asked for
    be fit for the purpose the business told you it would be fit for and for any purpose that you made known to the business before purchasing
    come with full title and ownership
    not carry any hidden debts or extra charges
    come with undisturbed possession, so no one has a right to take the goods away or prevent you from using them
    meet any extra promises made about performance, condition and quality, such as life time guarantees and money back offers
    have spare parts and repair facilities available for a reasonable time after purchase unless you were told otherwise.

Here we hit all the boxes, you have full title and ownership of the item, what you don't have free title of is the account that contains them, as this was given free of charge.

>Consumer guarantees do not apply if you:

  >  got what you asked for but simply changed your mind, found it cheaper somewhere else, decided you did not like the purchase or had no use for it
    **misused a product in any way that caused the problem**
    knew of or were made aware of the faults before you bought the product
    asked for a service to be done in a certain way against the advice of the business or were unclear about what you wanted

Hint read number 2 i even bolded it.



You are NOT covered for getting banned by the fact that you bought %%%%, because you are violating the laws you %%%%ing signed up to.

You can't claim that the product doesn't work because the skins work fine (your misusing them because your computer's are trash)

The thing that ISN'T working that you would have any chance of a claim on is FREE, which consumer affairs will not touch.

Here is what you're entitled to buy spending money to buy a skin: You can use the skin. That's it.
You aren't entitled to perfect, glitch free, lag free, 100% solid game performance. It doesn't say in the fine print "by buying this skin we promise to always always ALWAYS provide a flawless gameplay experience."

Consumer affairs doesn't care, Riot support doesn't care, nobody cares about your whining entitlement speeches that have no grounds whatsoever.
although really, it could have been trolls or %%%%s reporting you in game just because they didn't like you or thought it was funny

You don't get banned (or punished in general) unless you've genuinely been toxic. The system errs on the side of caution so that if you get punished you are 99.99% likely to be guilty of doing something wrong. That's why lots of toxic players slip through the cracks and don't get punished for a long time - it's better to let people like them stick around than to punish people who don't deserve it.
I  am under the understanding that the oceanic server is an automatic ban for being reported. NO TRIBUNAL REVIEW BY OTHER PLAYERS CAN YOU CONFIRM THIS. ???????

As far as I remember from Riot posts elsewhere, bans are manually reviewed by Riot staff, so if you get banned it means you HAVE to have done something wrong. Some things are automatic (low priority queue, chat restrictions) but those automatic things are based on extremely strict criteria.

The way it figures out if someone is truly guilty or not is if they receive a LOT more reports than the average. If you receive 2 or 3 reports every now and then it's no big deal, the system ignores it. If you receive reports nearly every single game, there's basically no chance you've been falsely reported all of those times - you're clearly being toxic at least some of the time.

Once again, bans are manually reviewed by Riot, and I believe the more severe chat restrictions/low priority queues are also reviewed, but I may be wrong on that part.
